body: despawn_recursive no longer exists on main, and the supporting code has been completely rewritten. Can you check if this reproduces on main?
Okay, helpful! Does it reproduce on https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/pull/17858?
That doesn't seem to fix it, unfortunately.

This one is actually pretty straightforward:

1. The scene spawner, when spawning a scene instance, tracks every entity that it spawns for the scene
2. `scene_spawner.despawn_instance`  will despawn every entity it spawned for that instance. hierarchy doesn't come into play here. It knows it made an entity, so when despawning the scene it assumes it should remove it.
3. When the SceneRoot component is removed from an entity, it triggers a call to `scene_spawner.despawn_instance` via a hook.
4. Therefore we get a "full scene despawn"

Whether or not a `despawn_instance` call should despawn the entire scene regardless of hierarchy is a matter of debate. I'm largely on team "hierarchy should determine scene membership". I'm not sure we should rock that boat before landing the new scene system. But I _do_ think that despawning _with normal APIs_  (ex: `entity.despawn()`) should _solely_ be hierarchical, as that is the least surprising behavior.

Therefore I think the fix should be "replace the despawn_instance() call in the SceneRoot removal hook with something that simply unregisters the instance / frees the metadata associated with it".

I'll do that now.

That way people that are currently relying on the "despawn everything" behavior can still use `scene_spawner.despawn_instance`. I don't expect there to be many (or any) people in this category, but its probably worth keeping around.

issue.body:
Fixes #17883

# Objective + Solution

When doing normal scene root entity despawns (which are notably now recursive), do not despawn instanced entities that are no longer in the hierarchy.

(I would not classify this as a bug, but rather a behavior change)

## Migration Guide

If you previously relied on scene entities no longer in the hierarchy being despawned when the scene root is despawned , use `SceneSpawner::despawn_instance()` instead.
